paragraphs: Also on the daily podcast: analysing Donald Trump’s love of financial sanctions and the illegal tiger farms of Asia
“They think the ‘Remainer establishment’ needs to be taught a lesson”—Boris Johnson’s new majority

NOW THAT the prime minister has a thumping parliamentary majority, Brexit is assured—but on what terms? And what other legislative shake-ups are in the works? President Donald Trump has relied heavily on financial sanctions, often in place of old-fashioned diplomacy. We ask whether that is an effective avenue of foreign policy. And an attempt to peek into Asia’s illegal tiger farms. Runtime: 21 min
For full access to print, digital and audio editions of The Economist, subscribe here: www.economist.com/radiooffer
Listen on: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | Google | Stitcher | TuneIn
title: The Intelligence - “They think the ‘Remainer establishment’ needs to be taught a lesson”—Boris Johnson’s new majority
